intro: Buchnera pubescens, commonly known as the hairy buchnera, is a flowering plant native to parts of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and leaves, which give it its common name. It produces showy, five-petaled flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. Buchnera pubescens is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests or along stream banks.
